title: Few powerful options to counter Akali in the midlane
body:
{{champion:84}}  ** Has seen so much play recently, even competitively as showcased ![during this Flashback episode](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Si9Mkq67blQ)  and according to [Champion.gg](https://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.banRate&order=descend) she is the most banned champion this patch, people _FEAR_ that champion. In this post, I hope to give you few options to beat her in lane so she cannot take over the game.**

First, let's talk about Akali's strenghts, and why she is feared : 
- Her shroud (W spell which makes her invisible), makes her invisible to _EVERYTHING_ and most notoriously, turrets, which means her diving potential is throught the roof. 
- Her Q which throws 5 projectiles in front of her and heal her if she has close to full energy gives her a good in lane sustain.
- She takes very short trades in lane, and then hides in her shroud which has a shorter cooldown than before, it makes it very hard to win trades, and she can heal back up if you manage to chuck her. 
- Most importantly, her kill potential post 6 with E (Gap closing ability which help her trigger her passive, a stronger AA after she has left a certain area arround the enemy) and her R (it gives very good mobility and crazy execution damage on the second part of the spell). 

**Counters :**

{{champion:45}}  is surprisingly good against Akali, his E stops all movement and two of his basic damaging abilities are not targeted, it means he can target her while she is in her shroud. This matchup will in my opinion revolve arround your E (which you should max second after Q for decreased cooldown and increased crowd control). The key is to not cast it unless she jumps on you, or play very passive when it's on cooldown since it's very easy for her to gap close. Arguably a skilled match up in your favor.

{{champion:131}}  is emerging as a good in lane counter at the moment. You'll have comparable wave clear but you'll pack a much greater punch in short engages (in which Akali thrives) not to mention the shield from your W (which you should max because it's just too good against melee assassins). Also, both of your damaging abilities (Q and W) can hit her in her shroud. The only problem comes from the fact that Akali brings much more than you late game especially during teamfights and that she ganks better and towerdives better when she is roaming. If she plays passiv in lane and roams for teamfights, it'll be hard. 

{{champion:38}}  is very good against Akali. His ability to soak up magic damage gives him the ability to keep up with Akali's short trades pre 6 and his ability to escape makes him safe. He goes toe to toe if not better in roams and his late game is unravelled, sadely, most people who intend to play Akali midlane will ban this guy. 

{{champion:90}} is the clear winner for me, hands down. You will push much much faster (assuming you max Q) which prevents her for roaming. Your passiv is a pain for all burst champions and champions who rely on short trades in general, Silence is great also and has a comparable cooldown with her shroud so you should be able to hit it every time, and if she wants to towerdive you, just R when she shows up and that's going to be a very sad Akali. Also Malz is safe in lane, works well post 6 with all junglers. Every time I've played this, it was a clear win.

**General tips : **

Picking up an {{summoner:3}} in the midlane is way too good against her, and generaly avoiding getting hit by her empowered AA, from her passive (which is easy to notice) is a good strategy. 

**Notes and ressources : **

- To understand {{champion:84}} , I used Professor Akali's guide on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R5a_MF-enuY&t=1100s).
- All champions I advised to play are those that I played myself against Akali (since I don't ban her in ranked and pre-pick her in ranked in all of my midlane games, I have some experience).
- I play at a mid-plat, low diamond level on my main account.

Some stats from [champion.gg](https://champion.gg) to try other match ups which can be interesting, and also to prove my point by statistics (yay statistics): 

- {{champion:84}}  wins **43.29%** of her games against  {{champion:45}} at Platinium + Elo, over **365** games.
- {{champion:84}}  wins **38.29%** of her games against  {{champion:38}}  at Platinium + Elo over **717 !!** games
- {{champion:84}}  wins **39.45%** of her games against  {{champion:90}} at Platinium + Elo over **403** games
- {{champion:84}}  wins **48.85%** of her games against  {{champion:131}}  at Platinium + Elo over **217** games

Matchup that I (or you) still need to try : 

- {{champion:84}}  wins **39.29%** of her games against  {{champion:136}}  at Platinium + Elo over **112** games
- {{champion:84}}  wins **39.71%** of her games against  {{champion:99}}   at Platinium + Elo over **544** games

I suspect {{champion:3}} , {{champion:78}} ,{{champion:55}}  to be good against her also.

Which champions have you tried against her ? Have you tried any of which I've tried ? Did you feel the same thing ? Who else would you recommend ? Comment to let everyone know and thanks in advance for your insight on the subject if you do.

Syndra, Annie, Talon, and Annie all have loads of counterpicks wtf? I feel like you're confusing "oppressive laner" with "uncounterable". Just because you're an oppressive laner doesn't mean literally no one beats you...lemme know how playing Zed into Vlad goes for instance.

That being said, I do hate when people only say "pick X to counter Y" rather than give actual gameplay tips

You change your build. Get executioners and hexdrinker, then build Botrk like Zed's used to. That gives you dps, allows you to shred the health he buys and gains via passive and cuts his healing down constantly. 
That's if you want to kill him.

The other solution is to buy early {{item:3117}} and roam roam roam. Get tiamat early so you can match his wave clear, then run away and devour bot lane. He won't be able to keep up and he doesn't hit towers hard enough to kill them b4 a jungler stops him.

Obviously isn't as simple as 1, 2, 3. Still need to execute properly but it works despite sacrificing some burst (you'll still delete people with 2-3 items assuming you/bot don't feed the enemy bot/jg)

Zed simply has no kill pressure on Vlad. Yes he can roam, but any champion can do that and *hope* to get fed. Vlad will outscale Zed and has a safe laning phase against him, therefor Vlad counters Zed. 

You can always do things to *improve* the matchup, aka changing builds and roaming, but this is simply not a matchup Zed wins nor is it one he outscales. Being countered doesn't mean the rest of the enemy team won't feed you.

My point is not to argue specific matchups and little details, the point is every champion has counters no matter how op you consider them to be. 

(unless you're kassawin or a select few other champions during very specific periods of league)

I unfortunately feel I must disagree with you.

While it feels bad to get into game and discover your champion is naturally bad against another champion and picking someone else would have made for an easier time, such a situation is a necessary byproduct of variety.

The only way to ensure counterpicking does not exist is to ensure that all champions have the same basic set of tools with nothing unique.  When unique abilities are added and variety is introduced, it is natural for some champions to be better against certain kits than others.

Now, it is possible for counterpicking to become so necessary as to hurt the game, when you must play one of a very small set of champions or you lose automatically.  I don't believe that is necessarily the point Akali is at right now, though, and I don't believe counterpicking is inherently unhealthy.

The reason for my post is that Counter picking has become more necessary and counterplay has been on the decline. While before counter picking gave you an advantage it did not nullify the laning phase. Previously (back when it was the forums) when people asked how to deal with champions they were given information like how build against them, how to space against them, and hop to abuse an opponents ability cooldowns correctly. At the present the "Counterplay" that is shown is always counter picks and does not provide the information that a player would actually be able to utilize if they are not the picked champion. This has become more and more the case since season 6 (maybe even earlier) wherein champions have less "windows" to deal with them outside of direct counters. 

While a necessary byproduct (as you say) was also true in the past Riot did decently well with having Counters be only Soft counters in 90% of cases. Exceptions being in ranged tops which they even said was a huge issue they wanted to correct, and they attempted to.

At the present we are at a point wherein champions are being played for how few options you have to deal with them instead of the options they themselves bring to the table.

She does lack counterplay how ever despite the fact that she can be beaten. Generally it's down to the akali being bad/stuffing up and less so you out playing her.

Her laning is obscenely safe with an easy farming/sustain tool. That also serves as strong poke as it matches many AA ranges and of course can be relentlessly spammed through minions.
People say predict her in her shroud but there's no proper way to do that, and even then the akali can dodge within the shroud.
Her shroud grows outward making it harder and harder to find her, and it gives her energy for some obscene reason.

Her ult has a sizable hitbox and obscenely fast animation making it both hard to miss and hard to dodge, and landing her main dash, which is silly (resting success on one spell is always bad idea, see zoe and sleep). So you have to flawlessly dodge and evade, otherwise she bursts you through barrier in a way that towers can't even assist in.

These options are reactive tho plus akali can build qss vs malz. There really aren't any counters that can shut her down like how pantheon, jayce and rumble shut down teemo (i'm a teemo main).  These are champs that she cant beat so easily. Akali either wins lane or goes even but never lose and that's why she is perma banned. This isn't an akali problem btw. I cant remember the last time riot released a champion with a counter.

Morgana also ruins akalis day. Fyi even of shes in shround if shes close to morg,morg can ult her and instantly know her location due to the tether. Makes landing a follow up snare and pool laughable, and morg can shove lane better and keep up with sustain.
